questions.name: institution_village
questions.label: What is the village of the institution?

tooltip.text: This question contains a list of possible household locations, starting with government area or district, down to the village.
Record GPS coordinates of a central place in the institution (e.g. in front of entrance)
OBSERVE: type of institution (located within community), Institution: any public building with open access to the communal toilets and handwashing facilities

options.name: School
Healthcare facility
Transport station (bus, train, airport, fuel, other)
Market
Public toilet
Government office/building
Camps (fishing, mining, farming)
Worship centres (churches, cathedrals, mosques, temples, other)
Burial place
Prisons
Private institutions (hotels, guesthouses, restaurants, offices, factories, centres of learning, nursing homes)

tooltip.text: OBSERVE: functional toilets observed in institution?, Functional toilet: the household toilet is functioning as intended, and can be used (that is, it is not blocked, abandoned or collapsed), Number of toilets: count the number of separate toilet stances or separate toilet seats (each of which can be used privately and separately)

options.name: G0 All institution toilets  are NON-functional
G1 Some institution toilets  are non-functional
G3 All toilets in the institution are functional
G0 All institution toilets are NOT flyproof
G1 Some institution toilets  are NOT flyproof
G3 All functional toilets are flyproof
G0 All institution toilets are NOT clean
G1 Some institution toilets  are NOT clean
G3 All functional toilets are clean

tooltip.text: OBSERVE: durable toilet slabs observed in institution?

options.name: G0 All institution toilet slabs are NOT durable
G1 Some institution toilet slabs are NOT durable
G3 All institution functional toilet slabs are durable

tooltip.text: OBSERVE: durable toilet pits observed in institution?

options.name: G0 All institution toilet pits are NOT durable
G1 Some institution toilet pits are NOT durable
G3 All institution functional toilet pits are durable

tooltip.text: OBSERVE: any evidence of surface outflows from containment systems (for example, visible outflows or leaks; increased vegetation growth around the pit; visible deposits from previous outflows), Surface outflows from containment: EITHER continuous outflows of faecal sludge or wastewater from overflow pipes, holes or leaks; OR evidence of previous surface outflows (for example, increased vegetation growth around the containment system, or visible sludge deposits from overflows or leaks).

options.name: G0 Visible surface outflows from containment
G1 Evidence of previous surface outflows from containment
G3 Safely managed containment in all institutions: no surface outflows

questions.name: safely_managed_faecal_sludge_containment
questions.label: Safely managed containment: faecal sludge contained

tooltip.text: INTERVIEW: has the institutional toilet containment (pit, tank or other) ever been emptied?, INTERVIEW: has the institutional toilet containment (pit, tank or other) ever filled up?, INTERVIEW: what happened when the institutional toilet containment (pit, tank or other) last filled up?

options.name: G0 No toilets, or no containment/collection systems
G0 Unsafe containment: open containers
G1 Risk of unsafe services: never emptied (intention to empty when full)
G3 Never emptied, not yet full (first toilets: no intention to empty)
G3 Never emptied, previous pits or tanks replaced when full
G3 Safely managed: sewer connection to LICENSED and FUNCTIONAL treatment site

questions.name: safely_managed_sanitation_services
questions.label: Safely managed sanitation services: emptying, treatment & disposal

tooltip.text: INTERVIEW: the last time it was emptied, where were the contents of the toilet containment emptied to?, INTERVIEW: the last time it was emptied, who emptied the toilet containment?, INTERVIEW (if the containment system is a lined pit or tank, which has never been emptied): what will happen when the toilet containment is full?, Licensed service provider: paid emptier that is approved and regulated by local authority to empty and transport toilet wastes, Unlicensed service provider: paid or unpaid emptier who is NOT approved by local authority to empty and transport toilet wastes (for example, family members, neighbours, friends, informal local emptiers) Off-site location: site for the treatment, disposal or use of toilet wastes that is away from the household/community, whose location may or may not be known to the household. Sewer connection to licensed and functional treatment site: the Public Health Office should check whether the sewer network flows to a licensed and functional treatment or disposal site.

options.name: G0 Unsafe disposal: to open pit, open space, open drain or water body (within 500m)
G0 Unsafe disposal: to open space, open drain or water body (MORE than 500m)
G0 Unsafe treatment or disposal: emptied by UNLICENSED service provider to off-site location
G0 Unsafe treatment or disposal: closed container removed by UNLICENSED service provider to off-site location
G0 Unsafe treatment or disposal: sewer connection to open discharge
G0 Unsafe services: other unsafely managed services
G1 Unsafe storage: stored for less than 2 years before use of stored waste
G1 Unsafe treatment or disposal: sewer connection to UNLICENSED or NON-FUNCTIONAL treatment site
G3 Safely managed: emptied to covered pit
G3 Safely managed: stored for MORE than 2 years before use of stored waste
G3 Safely managed: emptied by LICENSED service provider to off-site location
G3 Safely managed: closed container removed by LICENSED service provider to off-site location
G3 Safely managed: other safely managed services

questions.name: community_low_groundwater_contamination_risk
questions.label: COMMUNITY LEVEL ASSESSMENT: Low risk of groundwater contamination

options.name: G0 High risk of groundwater contamination
G2 Low risk of groundwater contamination

questions.name: outcome_safely_managed_usable_institutional_toilets
questions.label: Outcome result - Safely managed and usable institutional toilets

"G0 Institutional sanitation services UNSAFELY managed" : ((#1701329515408.includes("G3") && #1701331306965.includes("G3") && #1701331373050.includes("G3")  && #1701331438759.includes("G3")  && #1701331908015.includes("G3") && #1701332234354.includes("G3") && #1701332496414.includes("G3")  && #1701334423738.includes("G3")) ? "G3 Use of safely managed institutional sanitation services" : "G1 Inadequate institutional sanitation services") }

tooltip.text: OBSERVE: presence and location of handwashing facility INTERVIEW: is there only one handwashing facility, or are other facilities available?

options.name: G0 No handwashing facility
G1 Handwashing facility by toilet
G1 Handwashing facility in kitchen
G1 Portable handwashing facility (basin, jug, jerrycan, container)
G1 Two handwashing facilities
G1 More than two handwashing facilities

tooltip.text: OBSERVE: is water available at the handwashing facility? OBSERVE: where an empty water container is observed at the handwashing facility, visible wet ground (or wet materials) under the handwashing facility can be accepted as proof of the recent presence of water.

options.name: G0 No water available
G1 Water available
G1 Water container empty (evidence of washing)

tooltip.text: OBSERVE: is soap available at the handwashing facility?, INTERVIEW: is soap or detergent available for washing hands? , Soap: solid, liquid or powder soap or detergent

options.name: G0 No soap or other cleanser available
G0 Ash, mud or sand available
G0+ Soap available, NOT at handwashing facility
G1 Solid, liquid or powder soap available

tooltip.text: OBSERVE: is a permanent handwashing station available? Permanent handwashing station: facility made from durable materials, with a piped water connection or adequate water storage, and located in a fixed place that is appropriate for handwashing at critical times Market handwashing station: manufactured handwashing station from durable materails (bought from market or market trader) Portable basin: open container that can be easily picked up and moved

options.name: G0 No handwashing facility
G1 Jerrycan or other closed container
G1 Portable basin or other open container
G1 Other temporary handwashing facility
G3 Other permanent handwashing station
G3 Piped water tap with basin
G3 Market handwashing station with adequate water storage

questions.name: hands_free_operation_institutional_HWF
questions.label: Hands-free operation of institutional handwashing facility

tooltip.text: OBSERVE: mechanism to collect water or trigger water flow Hands-free operation: the handwashing station is operated by tap, or other hands-free mechanism that minimises contact with the water collection device and the water container

options.name: G0 Hands enter the water container (during collection and use)
G1 Water collected by hand (using ladle, cup, other)
G3 Closed water storage container with tap
G3 Piped water tap
G3 Other hands-free operation

tooltip.text: OBSERVE: facility to collect washing water, and facility to drain and dispose of the washing water Collection of washing water: container to collect dirty washing water (for example, a basin or other container) Drainage and disposal of washing water: drainage pipe or other facility to direct the washing water to an appropriate disposal point (for example, a soakpit or drain)

options.name: G0 No collection or disposal of washing water
G1 Collection of washing water without drainage or disposal
G3 Safe collection and disposal of washing water

questions.name: outcome_permanent_handwashing_stations_in_institution
questions.label: Outcome result - Permanent handwashing stations in institution

"G0 No or inadequate handwashing services" : ((#1701358601048.includes("G3") && #1701359046016.includes("G3") && #1701359231461.includes("G3")) ? "G3 Permanent handwashing services" : "G1 Non-durable handwashing services") }
